data.title: Obituaries
data.meta_description: The Star-Banner publishes news obituaries at no charge. Obituaries may also be read online at starbanner.com. Obituary information must be submitted by a funeral home or crematorium.
data.text:
Agnes Alford, 84

OCALA - Agnes Alford, 84, a homemaker, died Sunday, Nov. 10, 2002, at Munroe Regional Medical Center.

A native of Bronson, she moved here 47 years ago. Mrs. Alford was a member of Maricamp Road Church of Christ. She enjoyed country music, sewing and canning.

She is survived by her son, Elmer Worley, Ocala; three grandchildren; and four great-grandchildren.

Memorial contributions may be made to Mount Dora Christian Home and Bible School.

Hiers Funeral Home, Ocala, provided information.

Johnie F. Bivins, 84

OCALA - Johnie Frank Bivins, 84, a retired truck driver for Certified Grocers, died Wednesday, Nov. 6, 2002.

A native of Lakeland, he was a longtime resident of Ocala. Mr. Bivins was a U.S. Army veteran and a Methodist.

Survivors include his wife, Rosa M. Bivins, Ocala; daughter, Dorothy Mannings, Valdosta, Ga.; son, Andrew Carter, Ocala; brother, Thomas Bivins, Quitman, Ga.; sisters, Ovedia Mayers, Columbus, Ohio, Rosa Lee Smart and Rosetta Bivins, both of Quitman; six grandchildren; seven great-grandchildren; and two great-great-grandchildren.

Sellers Funeral Home, Ocala, provided information.

Noel D. Colvin, 62

HOMOSASSA - Noel D. Colvin, 62, a small engine mechanic, died Sunday, Nov. 10, 2002, in Crystal River.

A native of Talihina, Okla., he moved here from Grove, Okla., in 1998. Mr. Colvin was a life member of Disabled American Veterans, Chapter No. 70. He was a Vietnam-era veteran of the U.S. Navy.

Survivors include his daughter, Shannon Smith, Ardmore, Okla.; companion, Kathryn DeShazer, Homosassa; wife, DeLois Colvin, Kingston, Okla.; and three grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his son, Noel D. Colvin.

Hooper Funeral Home, Homosassa, provided information.

Helen Devaney, 68

WEIRSDALE - Helen Devaney, 68, died Thursday, Oct. 31, 2002, at Avante in Leesburg.

Ms. Devaney was a native of Ocala. She was a member of First Baptist Church of Weirsdale.

She is survived by her aunt, Edna Parker, Wildwood; and caregiver, Sybil D. Wilson, Leesburg.

Hiers-Baxley Funeral Services, Lady Lake, provided information.

Everett Hawley, 64

OCALA - Everett Hawley, 64, a banker, died Friday, Nov. 8, 2002.

A native of Casper, Wyo., he moved here from Tampa 30 years ago. Mr. Hawley was a life member of Disabled American Veterans. He was a U.S. Navy veteran.

He is survived by his sister, Carol Stotz, Bella Vista, Calif.

Forest Lawn Funeral Home, Ocala, provided information.

Minnie Fuhrmann, 93

HERNANDO - Minnie Fuhrmann, 93, a retired assembler for General Motors, died Monday, Nov. 11, 2002.

A native of Germany, she moved here from Waterport, N.Y., in 2001.

Survivors include her son, Robert Fuhrmann, Hernando; daughters, Nancy Krzeminski, North Tonawanda, N.Y., and Debres Murawski, Buffalo, N.Y.; six grandchildren; and 10 great-grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by her husband, August A. Fuhrmann, who died July 1, 1989.

Hooper Funeral Home, Beverly Hills, provided information.

Maria C. Galue, 83

OCALA - Maria C. Galue, 83, a homemaker, died Sunday, Nov. 10, 2002, at Munroe Regional Medical Center.

A native of Pivijay, Colombia, she moved here from New Jersey seven years ago. Mrs. Galue was Catholic.

Survivors include her daughters, Itala Galue and Ediltrudis Fuqua, both of Ocala; sons, Sigilfredo Galue, Elizabeth, N.J., Fredy Galue and Federico Galue, both of Miami; brother, Carlos J. Medina, Colombia; 18 grandchildren; nine great-grandchildren; and three great-great-grandchildren.

Forest Lawn Funeral Home, Ocala, provided information.

Frank D. Giglio, 81

HOMOSASSA - Frank Dominico Giglio, 81, a retired union maintenance worker, died Saturday, Nov. 9, 2002.

A native of Babylon, N.Y., he moved here from Catskill, N.Y., in 1992. Mr. Giglio was an honorary member of Florida Sheriff's Association. He served in the U.S. Navy during World War II.

Survivors include his wife of 13 years, Ingeborg Rohde Giglio, Homosassa; and sisters, Jean Arrnato, Queens, N.Y., and Sadie Migliore, Babylon, N.Y.

Hooper Funeral Home, Homosassa, provided information.

Mable T. Johnson, 91

OCALA - Mable T. Johnson, 91, a homemaker, died Saturday, Nov. 9, 2002, at Palm Garden of Ocala.

A native of Worthington Springs, she was a longtime resident of Palatka. Mrs. Johnson was a member of First Baptist Church of Palatka and Palatka Garden Club.

Survivors include her son, Robert James, Ocala; sister, Anne Wallace, Palm Coast; three grandchildren; and one great-grandchild.

She was preceded in death by her husbands, Lewis James and James W. Johnson.

Johnson-Overturf Funeral Home, Palatka, provided information.

Genevieve LaGarde, 89

LECANTO - Genevieve LaGarde, 89, a retired office clerk, died Monday, Nov. 11, 2002.

Mrs. LaGarde was a native of Michigan. She was a member of Our Lady of Grace Catholic Church in Beverly Hills.

She is survived by her guardian, Albert LaGarde, Fort Myers.

She was preceded in death by her husband, Anton LaGarde, who died Feb. 9, 1999.

Hooper Funeral Home, Beverly Hills, provided information.

Donald F. Nichter, 72

OCALA - Donald Francis Nichter, 72, a retired quality control technical supervisor, died Thursday, Nov. 7, 2002, at Palm Gardens of Ocala.

A native of Buffalo, N.Y., he moved here from Java Center, N.Y., in 1979. A U.S. Navy veteran, Mr. Nichter was a member and past commander of American Legion Post No. 637. He was Roman Catholic.

Survivors include his wife of 51 years, Joanne Nichter, Ocala; sons, Paul Nichter, Islesboro, Maine, Kurt Nichter, Hamburg, N.Y., Eric Nichter, Anderson, S.C., and Christopher Nichter, Glenwood, N.Y.; mother, Lillian Nichter, Kenmore, N.Y.; brother, James Nichter, Gaithersburg, Md.; sister, Marilyn Bischof, Merritt Island; and eight grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by son, Rory Nichter.

National Cremation Society, Fruitland Park, provided information.

John G. Stiene, 73

FORT McCOY - John Gilbert Stiene, 73, a retired technician for Martin Marietta, died Sunday, Nov. 10, 2002, at Putnam Community Medical Center in Palatka.

A native of Charlerol, Pa., he moved here from Ocoee in 1988. Mr. Stiene was a member of Loyal Order of the Moose, Fraternal Order of the Eagles, Veterans of Foreign Wars and Elks Lodge. He was a U. S. Navy veteran of World War II.

Survivors include his daughters, Sue Barker, Ocoee, Debra Guitz, Melbourne, LuAnne Stiene Parr and Jennifer Huttel, both of Winter Garden; companion, Patsy Witt, Fort McCoy; ex-wife, Mary L. Stiene, Winter Garden; and two grandchildren.

Hiers Funeral Home, Ocala, provided information.

David L. Sutherland, 73

OCALA - David Leslie Sutherland, 73, a retired bus driver, died Wednesday, Nov. 6, 2002, at Munroe Regional Medical Center.

A native of Manchester, Jamaica, he moved here from Bronx, N.Y., in 1988. Mr. Sutherland was an active member of Silver Springs Shores Seventh-day Adventist Church. He enjoyed gardening and reading.

Survivors include his wife, Barbara Sutherland, Ocala; sons, Charles Lloyd and Christopher Lloyd, both of Ocala; daughters, Betty A. Hodge, Orlando and Monica Jackson, Queens, N.Y.; seven grandchildren; and eight great-grandchildren.

He was preceded in death by his wife, Ivy M. Sutherland.

Roberts Funeral Home, Bruce Chapel East Ocala, provided information. http://www.robertsfuneralhomes.com

James W. Templeton, 71

ORANGE SPRINGS - James W. Templeton, 71, a retired engineer, died Sunday, Nov. 10, 2002, at E.T. York Hospice Care Center in Gainesville.

A native of Kansas City, Mo., he moved to Orange Springs from Ocala in 1980. Mr. Templeton retired from Hospital Corporation of America after 18 years. He served in the U.S. Air Force for 20 years. He was a member of Keystone Heights Golf and Country Club; life member of Veterans of Foreign Wars Post No. 10208, Salt Springs; American Legion Post No. 293, Interlachen; Gain Rider Association; and was a Master Gardener.

Survivors include his wife of 39 years, Patsy Templeton, Orange Springs; stepson, Hayward S. Harrison, Albany, Ga.; brothers, Jack Templeton, Excelsior, Mo., and Tommy Dayringer, Drexel, Mo.; sisters, Betty Fowler, Oak Grove, Mo., and Pat Michler, Excelsior Springs, Mo., and Margie Buey, Freemont, Neb.; and one grandchild.

Masters Funeral Home, Interlachen, gave information.

Erma E. Tierney, 84

OCALA - Erma E. Tierney, 84, a homemaker, died Friday, Nov. 8, 2002.

A native of Roebling, N.J., she moved here from Palm Bay in 1999. Mrs. Tierney was a member of Order of the Eastern Star. She was Methodist.

Survivors include her husband, James Tierney, Ocala; son, Kenneth Barber, Silver Springs; daughter, Judith Taege, Cape May, N.J.; brother, Kenneth C. Johnson, Cocoa Beach; three grandchildren; and three great-grandchildren.

Florida Cremation Society, Ocala, provided information.

Arladene J. Wille, 78

OCALA - Arladene J. Wille, 78, a homemaker, died Monday, Nov. 11, 2002, at Estelle's Hospice House.

A native of Elliott, Ill., she moved here from Union Grove, Wis., in 1982. Mrs. Wille was a member of First Christian Church of Ocala. She enjoyed traveling, gardening and playing bingo.

Survivors include her son, Ronald Wille, Junction City, Wis.; daughter, Carolyn Haxton, Fort Wayne, Ind.; brother, Vernon Kegley, Walla Walla, Wash.; sisters, Madeline Burns, Palatka, Winifred Gash, Kankakee, Ill., Beverly Elmer, San Antonio, Texas, Almeda Nemeth, Gilbert, Ariz., Gwenellyn Lopinski, Justin, Ill., and Georgia Blake, Venice; six grandchildren; and four great-grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by her husband, Roy G. Wille.

Roberts Funeral Home, Bruce Chapel East Ocala, provided information. http://www.robertsfuneralhomes.com

Aleph Williams, 83

OCALA - Aleph Williams, 83, a caregiver, died Sunday, Nov. 10, 2002.

A native of Lumber City, Ga., she moved here from Longwood in 1958. Mrs. Williams was a 30-year member of Church of God of Prophecy.

Survivors include her daughters, Barbara D. Aultman, Freeport and Kathleen Dehoff, Valdosta, Ga.; son, Roscoe H. Rolin, Ocala; nine grandchildren, 21 great-grandchildrenmugline here
